Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
GameLogic
public class GameLogic extends Object
Contains the main logic for the game, as it processes it

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    botNextCommand()
    Sets out what should be the bots next move pick up if it occupies a space with gold leave the game if it occupies an exit and has enough gold to win else call the method that decides the bot movement (random or tracking player)
    private String
    displayGoldRequired()
    Returns the gold required to win.
    private String
    displayPlayerGoldOwned()
    Returns the gold collected so far
    private void
    leaveGame()
    Prints leaving message and ends the program if the player is on an Exit also prints to the terminal whether the player has won or lost
    private char[][]
    lookCommand(int[] coordinates)
    Generates the 5x5 2d array around a coordinate
    static void
    main(String[] args)
    Method that initiates the game by running default constructor to get a map then calls runGame method
    private void
    pickUpGold()
    Checks to see if the player is above gold, if true increment gold, remove it from the map and print the message to the terminal
    private void
    runGame()
    Spawns player/bot in and provides a constant looping prompting for user input until the player can quit

    spawnUser(char opposingPlayer)
    Generates a random valid coordinate the player or the bot can spawn at
    private void

      public GameLogic()
      Default constructor that allows for a user to select a map

  • Method Details

    • runGame

      private void runGame()
      Spawns player/bot in and provides a constant looping prompting for user input until the player can quit

    • spawnUser

      private int[] spawnUser(char opposingPlayer)
      Generates a random valid coordinate the player or the bot can spawn at
      Parameters:
      opposingPlayer - char, used to detect if bot spawns above a player
      Returns:
      returns a unique spawn coordinates

    • lookCommand

      private char[][] lookCommand(int[] coordinates)
      Generates the 5x5 2d array around a coordinate
      Parameters:
      coordinates - coordinates in which the 5x5 grid will be around
      Returns:
      5x5 grid
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - we try to access outside the border of the full map causes a instead, we can fill it with '#'

    • updatePlayerPosition

      private void updatePlayerPosition(char direction)
      updates the player position on the board (also checks to see if it's a valid move)
      Parameters:
      direction - char datatype that is either 'N' or 'S' or 'E' or 'W'
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when try to access outside map array, instead we treat this as a 'Fail'

    • botNextCommand

      private void botNextCommand()
      Sets out what should be the bots next move pick up if it occupies a space with gold leave the game if it occupies an exit and has enough gold to win else call the method that decides the bot movement (random or tracking player)

    • displayGoldRequired

      private String displayGoldRequired()
      Returns the gold required to win.
      Returns:
      "Gold to win: {gold required to win on the map}".

    • displayPlayerGoldOwned

      private String displayPlayerGoldOwned()
      Returns the gold collected so far
      Returns:
      "Gold Owned: {gold owned by the human player}".

    • pickUpGold

      private void pickUpGold()
      Checks to see if the player is above gold, if true increment gold, remove it from the map and print the message to the terminal

    • leaveGame

      private void leaveGame()
      Prints leaving message and ends the program if the player is on an Exit also prints to the terminal whether the player has won or lost

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Method that initiates the game by running default constructor to get a map then calls runGame method
